messages.title: THE PROGRESS WE'VE MADE TOGETHER AS A NATION SINCE 2010
messages.content: The deficit down by almost two thirds, income tax cut for 31 million people, 2.8 million new jobs, welfare capped to reward work, 3 million new apprenticeships, safer streets with crime down by a third.

messages.title: Think Jeremy Corbyn as Prime Minister is never going to happen?
messages.content: DON'T BE SO SURE. Shock wins in global politics hint at possible success for Corbyn, risk for higher debt, higher taxes, economic chaos.

messages.title: AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM THERESA MAY TO YOU
messages.content: Getting on with the job of securing the best possible deal from Brexit is vital. Aiming for a strong economy, well-paid jobs, affordable housing, good school places, strong NHS. Only a good deal from Brexit can keep our economy and all the public services we rely on.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A strong economy with well-paid jobs, more affordable housing, and good school places for every child.
A strong economy paying for a strong NHS.
Securing the best possible deal from Brexit, ensuring it works for the UK, and maintaining a strong negotiating hand.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Warning against a coalition of chaos if not voting for Conservatives, reference to 'shock' political wins to suggest tactical voting might be necessary.

issues.brexitEurope: Securing the best possible deal from Brexit is vital, EU leaders agree on tough stance at special Brexit summit.
issues.economy: Aiming for a stronger economy with well-paid jobs, improvements in public services.
issues.education: Good school places for every child.
issues.governance: Strong and stable leadership, maintaining a strong negotiating hand in Brexit.
issues.health: A strong NHS backed by a stronger economy.
issues.immigration: Take back control of our borders.

quotes.text: EU leaders agree on tough stance at special Brexit summit
